channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: 3 Lights out Near park, 16th January
item.description:
On downs road/downs Lane 3 streetlights labeled 19,20&21 were off tonight. The service hatch to number 20 was open and the rest of the row of lights was on which makes me think there is a fault.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Downs Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: All out - three or more street lights in a row

item.title: Street light 100H CP5 in Chislehurst High Street Car Park is not working - a row of three lights is not working, 15th January
item.description:
Street light 100H CP5 in Chislehurst High Street Car Park is not working, in fact a whole row of three street lights in the car park is not working now I have already reported 100H CP4 not working (ref 8587379), but tonight have noticed street light CP5 next to it and the street light in the far north west corner (probably CP6) is not working.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Adelaide Road, Chislehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: White give way lines not visible, 15th January
item.description:
When you are travelling up Rowley Avenue, in the dark, past all the parked cars, you are not aware that this is a cross roads and you have to give way at the intersection with Burnt Oak. The white lines on the road have been worn away. We were visitors at the weekend and unfamiliar with the road layout and had a lucky escape.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Rowley Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fridges and household goods, 15th January
item.description:
Another flytipper, a lady on the back of Credon Road, decided to throw her fridge and household items outside these bins. It's not safe, it could fall and really hurt someone, something needs to be done about these flytippers, they don't care and co tinue to re offend.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Sofa and household goods, 15th January
item.description:
This is an ongoing problem in Credon Road, another resident that lives at the end of the street has dumped their sofa and household goods outside the bin. This man decided to drag it down the road and place it outside the bins, it is unsafe and dangerous, people could get hurt as there is no pavement to walk. Why is there no camera to catch these people illegally dumping their rubbish!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rain water pooling on pavement/surface water defect, 15th January
item.description:
When there is heavy rain it is impossible to use the pavement here as the puddle/flood is deep and can stretch the width of the pavement. It also makes the house difficult to access without boots. This is an ongoing issue and is getting worse. The gradient of the pavement needs to be altered to direct water into the drain on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Avington Grove, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
